intro: Sonchus brachylobus f. spathulatus, commonly known as the broadleaf sowthistle, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with broad, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, which attracts various pollinators. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
